text:
A tool I'm using produces path elements (for closed paths, like triangles) which have a trailing moveto 
after the final closepath (Z) command. This causes the path to be rendered as if it were not closed: that 
is, the place where it returns to its starting point is rendered with two line-endings, rather than one 
line-join. I would expect that adding a trailing moveto to a path would not affect its rendering at all.

I'm using the Squiggle viewer from the Batik-1.5.1 release, on Mac OS X 10.3.4. "java -version" displays 
this:

java version "1.4.2_03"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_03-117.1)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-34, mixed mode)
creator: wiml@omnigroup.com
wiml@omnigroup.com
text:
Created attachment 12576
A minimal SVG file demonstrating the problem

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
This appears to be a bug on Mac OS X.
I don't see this behaviour on Windows.

I think I have worked around this issue.
